properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 2ND FLR WITHOUT A CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: APARTMENTS 2 AND 3 FRONT BEDROOMS - MISSING SMOKE DETECTOR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: BASEMENT BOILER/LAUNDRY ROOM - MISSING CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 3RD FLOOR APARTMENT; MISSING CARBON MONOXIDE.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: BASEMENT APT., MISSING SMOKE DETECTOR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: BASEMENT APT. MISSING CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: THIS IS A THREE STORY BUILDING THAT ORIGINALLY CONTAINED SIX APARTMENTS. TWO FIRST FLOOR APARTMENTS AND BASEMENT STORAGE SPACES CONVERTED TO A HOSTEL WITH ACCOMMODATIONS FOR AT LEAST 43 PEOPLE.  AT FIRST FLOOR NORTH THERE IS THE GUEST RECEPTION WITH A DESK CLERK, COMMUNAL KITCHEN/DINING AREA, BATHROOM AND TWO GUEST ROOMS WITH A TOTAL OF 7 BUNKBEDS.  AT FIRST FLOOR SOUTH THERE ARE FOUR GUEST ROOMS WITH A TOTAL OF 10 BUNKBEDS AND TWO WASHROOMS. AT NORTH BASEMENT THERE ARE TWO GUEST ROOMS WITH A QUEEN BED IN ONE ROOM AND FOUR SINGLE BEDS IN THE SECOND ROOM, BATHROOM AND LAUNDRY ROOM.  AT SOUTH BASEMENT THERE IS A RECREATION AREA, BATHROOM AND GUEST ROOM WITH 2 BUNKBEDS.  THE TWO APARTMENTS ON THE FIRST FLOOR WERE RADICALLY ALTERED AND THE BASEMENT SPACES TRANSFORMED FROM UNFINISHED STORAGE TO COMPLETE THE CONVERSION.  WORK INCLUDED, BUT WAS NOT LIMITED TO INTERIOR DEMOLITION, ERECTION OF PARTITIONS, PARTIAL ENCLOSURE OF REAR PORCHES, NEW WALL, FLOOR AND CEILING FINISHES AND ALTERATIONS TO THE ELECTRICAL AND PLUMBING SYSTEMS.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Performed or allowed construction or alteration work contrary to original plan of construction without obtaining a permit.  (13-32-010, 13-12-050)

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: OBTAIN PERMIT FOR: (1) CONVERSION OF TWO FIRST FLOOR APARTMENTS AND BASEMENT STORAGE SPACES TO A HOSTEL WITH 9 GUEST ROOMS, COMMUNAL KITCHEN/DINING AREA, RECREATIOIN ROOM AND LAUNDRY ROOM. (2) ENCLOSURE OF REAR WOOD PORCH SYSTEMS TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL LIVING AREA FOR UNITS ON FIRST, SECOND AND THIRD FLOORS. (3) CONSTRUCTION OF DECK ON ROOF OF GARAGE. (4) CONSTRUCTION OF ENCLOSURE LINKING GARAGE TO THE BUILDING.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: SMOKE DETECTOR / FIRST FLOOR APARTMENT.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR / BASEMENT AND FIRST FLOOR APARTMENT.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.
